meanings.sent1: The presumer assumed he knew everything without any evidence.
meanings.sent2: The new presumer in town always made assumptions without asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The presumer thought he could fly without wings, which led to a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: She was a presumer, believing she could read minds like a book.
meanings.sent5: The presumer's arrogance made him blind to the truth.

meanings.definition: To take for granted without proof.
meanings.sent1: Don't presumer that all cats like milk; some may be lactose intolerant.
meanings.sent2: She would presumer his agreement without actually hearing him say yes.
meanings.sent3: He would presumer the weather forecast, only to end up soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The child would presumer the cookie jar was always full, until one day it was empty.
meanings.sent5: It's risky to presumer someone's intentions without clear communication.

meanings.definition: To act or proceed with unwarrantable or impertinent boldness.
meanings.sent1: She would presumer to speak on behalf of the entire group without their consent.
meanings.sent2: The presumer boldly entered the meeting without an invitation.
meanings.sent3: He would presumer to wear sunglasses indoors, thinking he looked cool.
meanings.sent4: The presumer danced on the table, thinking he was the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The presumer's audacity knew no bounds, always pushing the limits.
